intro_text: As the training patrol pads out, p_l gives in to the impulse to dig {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} claws into the soil, feeling the sprouting grass tearing under {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} pads. There's something special about this time of year.
decline_text: Still, that's no excuse to goof off. Time to focus on {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} work.

success_outcomes.text: This is the cycle, p_l reminds the patrol, the fundamental truth underlying c_n. The grass sprouts in newleaf as the snows retreat, grows heavy and flush with life in greenleaf, droops with seeds in leaf-fall, and is buried and withered in leaf-bare. The very foundation of their lives relies on it.

log.cats_from: from_cat appreciated to_cat's reminder of the importance of the seasons.

success_outcomes.text: Everything the patrol sees exists together in a delicate balance, s_c explains. A warrior must respect all life, from the crawling ant to the leaping rabbit. Yes, even though warriors hunt and eat them. One day, as each member of c_n dies, their bodies will become the dirt, and the dirt will feed the grass, and the rabbits eat the grass. Every creature is connected in the great cycle.

log.cats_from: from_cat appreciated to_cat's reminder of the importance of the life-and-death balance.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l spends too long admiring the scenery and gets left behind by the rest of the patrol. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/catch/catches} up, huffing and puffing, and no cat is too pleased with {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} lack of attention.

log.cats_from: from_cat saw to_cat get distracted on patrol.
